intro: Erysimum rigidum, commonly known as the rigid wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30 to 60 centimeters. The plant features upright, rigid stems covered in fine hairs, and its leaves are linear to lanceolate in shape. Its bright yellow flowers, which bloom in spring, are borne in racemes and are attractive to pollinators. Erysimum rigidum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is well adapted to dry, sunny environments.
